titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Henry C. Smith papers (series 71) 1872-1936
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Henry C. Smith papers (series 71)

bioghist.p: Henry Clement Smith (1860-1936), graduate of the University of Pennsylvania and a civil engineeer, was the son of Rebecca Levis Wood and Abraham Lewis Smith and the brother of Rebecca Emily Smith, Lewis Lawrence Smith, and Helen Bright Smith. He married Anna Potts Cheney (1868-1961), and they had one son, Lewis Cheney Smith (1891-)

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Henry Clement Smith. Materials include correspondence with Helen Bright Smith, Abraham Lewis Smith and Rebecca W. Smith; course notes; itineraries; receipts; postcards; and appointment books. The collection also includes copies of the Young American.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
